mcphee@... wrote:
> The problem is that our system is quite complex, with lots of
> different components all feeding off the same random number stream.

Maybe, that's pointing towards the real problem. Unit testing should
strive for minimal granularity, i.e. test one component (unit) at a
time. Depending on your current architecture and dependencies between
components you will have to create lots of dummy and/or mock objects.
Major refactorings might be necessary.

Maybe a first step could be to give each component its own random number
stream. Either for testing only or fpr both test and production.

Johannes
